oai_dc:dc.dc:description: بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم الحمد لله الذي انزل القرآن العظيم معجزا ببلاغته واسكت به مناطيق العرب لعظيم فصاحته... :Incipit

According to the colophon (f. 7v), copy completed on 22 Muḥarram 1269 AH [November 5, 1852 AD] in the hand of Muṣṭafá ibn Muḥammad al-ʻUrḍī al-Ḥalabī, most probably in Damascus. "Manāsik sharīfah" completed by the same copyist on 25 Muḥarram 1269 AH [November 8, 1852 AD].
Written in one column, from 20 to 21 lines per pages, in black rubricated in red.

With: Beginning of a text by Khālid ibn Aḥmad al-Shahrazūrī al-Naqshbandī al-Mujaddidī on the theological question of kasb (ff. 4v-5r) ; Manāsik sharīfah / jamʻ al-Mawlá al-Sayyid Muḥammad ʻUmar al-Ghazzī (ff. 5v-7v).
MS Arab 151. Houghton Library, Harvard University.
